creator: apache@kore-nordmann.de
text:
Apache fails unexpectedly parsing the UserAgent header in a PUT request from
Konqueror:

The request:
PUT /TODO HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Konqueror/3.5; Linux) KHTML/3.5.8 (like Gecko)
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-control: no-cache
Accept: text/html, image/jpeg, image/png, text/*, image/*, */*
Accept-Encoding: x-gzip, x-deflate, gzip, deflate
Accept-Charset: utf-8, utf-8;q=0.5, *;q=0.5
Accept-Language: en
Host: webdav
Connection: Keep-Alive

Is responded by Apache with a "400 Bad Request" response.

If I remove the User-Agent header, the request succeeds ("200 OK").

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Is anything logged to error_log?  (or similarly, what does the response body
contain?)
Over two years in NEEDINFO; assuming the OP found it was a NOTABUG and lost interest.
creator: nick@webthing.com
